Name: Coffin
Description: The fine mummiform coffin belonging to Nesmin, son of Ankh-hapy. Other decoration includes the figures of various human and snake-headed deities along with the four Sons of Horus. At the foot end of the lid are two recumbent jackals representing Anubis and accompanied by 'utterances'. On the underside of the foot of the lid are the seated figures of Isis and Nephthys, flanking a djed-pillar that wears the atef-crown with pendant uraei.
